title: Home
text:
Dr. Antonio Rojas Castro
I am a Digital Humanities Research Associate at the Freie Universität Berlin and the University of Tübingen. I specialize in digital editions and computational literary studies. My current project focuses on network analysis and the role of character typologies such as the gracioso in Golden Age theater in Spain, using computational methods and corpus analysis.
I am also a Part-Time Lecturer at Universidad Internacional de La Rioja (MA in Digital Humanities). I am currently teaching a course on digital scholarly editing and supervising MA dissertations on Digital Humanities.
I have voluntereed in several organizations: the European Association for Digital Humanities (2015-2018), The Programming Historian en español (2016-2020), and the Asociación de Humanidades Digitales Hispánicas (2021-2023).
You can found more information about my work at:

ORCID: https://orcid.org/0000-0002-8916-4997

GitHub: https://github.com/arojascastro

Zotero: https://www.zotero.org/antoniorojascastro

title: About
text:
I am a Digital Humanities scholar working across digital editions, computational literary analysis, and open science. I teach at UNIR (MA in Digital Humanities) and supervise MA dissertations on digital scholarly editing.
Previously, I volunteered with: - European Association for Digital Humanities (2015–2018) - Programming Historian en español (2016–2020) - Asociación de Humanidades Digitales Hispánicas (2021–2023)
